quote-text:
According to Sullivan, whom I spoke with recently, his interrogation of Amy came to an âabrupt haltâ when Judy Bishop entered the booking room, in a conspicuous breach of protocol. One of the captains on duty told him that Judy Bishop had spoken to Polio and explained that the shooting had been an accidentâand Polio believed her.

âI was like, What?â Sullivan told me. He recalled complaining to the captain, âIf we let every person go because their mother didnât think they committed a crime, there would be no point in arresting anyone.â But he was told that Polio had ordered the release, and that he was âto obey that order.â
quote-source: Patrick Radden Keefe, A Loaded Gun, The New Yorker, February 11, 2013.
